text: [Music]
hydrogen is emerging as a Cornerstone of
the global energy transition with
governments and industries investing
heavily in hydrogen
infrastructure understanding the
technology applications of hydrogen
Solutions and policy impacts provides a
Competitive Edge and new opportunities
in the rapidly growing green economy you
can use this knowledge to identify
opportunities and to evaluate challenges
and risk in hydrogen related business
I'm Shaolin Zen professor in mechanical
engineering and energy science and
engineering I'm Naomi bones managing
director here at Stanford for two
programs one on natural gas and one on
hydrogen in this course we'll take you
on a journey through the vast landscape
of hydrogen and its role in a low carbon
future we start with the basics
introducing you to why hydrogen is such
a powerful tool in reducing greenhouse
gas
emissions you'll dive deeper to
understand how hydrogen is produced from
traditional methods to the most advanced
processes you'll understand how
technology is evolving to meet the
demands of a cleaner energy Market as we
move forward you'll uncover the critical
aspects of hydrogen storage and the
delivery we'll look at unique Solutions
being developed to transport and store
hydrogen safely and effectively this
knowledge is essential for anyone aiming
to understand the logistics of hydrogen
and how it can be applied on a global
scale then we'll dive into real world
applications where hydrogen is already
making an impact you'll see how
Industries like Transportation energy
storage and heavy manufacturing are
leveraging hydrogen to transition
towards Greener practices finally will
demystify the economic and the policy
landscape surrounding hydrogen you gain
insights into how Global policies and
incentives are shaping the industry and
driving hydrogen toward mainstream
adoption join us as we navigate the path
to a cleaner sustainable future with
hydrogen as a key player
[Music]
